intro: Tithymalus hohenackeri, commonly known as the Hohenacker's tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its blooming period occurs in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
